The codec 'VP7' doesn't work/exist for Apple OS X or any Linux distribution (such as Ubuntu, Fedora, OpenSUSE).

Waste of bandwidth in my opinion.

Hey Keggerman or anyone there who knows, how do i download this? As a first time user i have no idea whats going on. I hit download this torrent and it says open or save when i hit save it takes like 1 second and nothing happens frustrating. I have no idea what to do eh....

Linux users can convert one of these 'VP7' files to a VLC-playable AVI file with this one-liner:
mencoder somesourcevideo.avi -oac copy -ovc xvid -xvidencopts pass=1 -o /dev/null && mencoder somesourcevideo.avi -oac copy -ovc xvid -xvidencopts pass=2:bitrate=950 -o destinationvideo.avi

Change 'somesourcevideo.avi' and 'destinationvideo.avi' to the input and output files respectively.  Requires 'mencoder' to be installed.  For batch processing, see the script on this page:
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=502179

DO NOT DOWNLOAD. As everyone has stated, it is encrypted with a special codec. I got that codec and I had to then convert an episode (which took 3 hours) to .AVI with a MPEG codec. Now it worked, but it went from DVD quality to something like a blurred VHS tape recording. You have been warned... KEGGERMAN REMOVE THIS SHIT!

Thank you friend! And don't worry with the people said. People please use goomplayer! And don't forget that Keggerman put this torrent for you for free! If you don't like the codec buy the original dvd and help the producers! Thank you from Brazil man, a place where everything is too much expensive.
